dn34:1.6.44.pli: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ visaṁyuttaṁ kāmehi.
dn34:1.6.44.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from sensual pleasures.

dn34:1.6.64.pli: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ visaṁyuttaṁ sakkāyena.
dn34:1.6.64.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from identity.

dn34:2.3.66.pli: idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn34:2.3.66.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

dn34:2.3.96.en: And how is a mendicant [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind?

dn34:2.3.98.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttacitto hoti. #7.9
dn34:2.3.98.en: That’s how a mendicant is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind.

dn34:2.3.99.en: And how is a mendicant [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom?

dn34:2.3.105.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti.
dn34:2.3.105.en: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

dn33:2.1.104.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from sensual pleasures.

dn33:2.1.124.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from identity.

dn33:3.3.51.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn33:3.3.51.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

dn33:3.3.78.en: And how is a mendicant [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind?

dn33:3.3.80.en: That’s how a mendicant is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind.

dn33:3.3.85.en: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

an10.20:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.20:2.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

an10.20:11.3.en: That’s how a mendicant is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind.

sn46.6:3.3.pli: Tassa ṭhito ca kāyo hoti, ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ajjhattaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
sn46.6:3.3.en: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn46.6:3.5.pli: Tassa ṭhito ca kāyo hoti ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ajjhattaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
sn46.6:3.5.en: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn46.6:4.6.pli: Tassa ṭhito ca kāyo hoti, ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ajjhattaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
sn46.6:4.6.en: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn46.6:4.8.pli: Tassa ṭhito ca kāyo hoti, ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ajjhattaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
sn46.6:4.8.en: Their mind and body are steady internally, well settled and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn46.6:5.1.pli: Yato kho, kuṇḍaliya, bhikkhuno cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā manāpāmanāpesu rūpesu ṭhito ca kāyo hoti, ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ajjhattaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
sn46.6:5.1.en: When a mendicant’s mind and body are steady internally, they’re well settled and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m when it comes to both agreeable and disagreeable sights,

sn22.56:5.1.pli: Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṁ rūpaṁ abhiññāya …pe… evaṁ rūpanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ abhiññāya, rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā te suvimuttā.
sn22.56:5.1.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known form in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, are freed by not grasping: they are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn22.56:5.2.en: Those who are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m are consummate ones.

sn22.56:15.1.pli: Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṁ viññāṇaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ viññāṇasamudayaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ viññāṇanirodhaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ viññāṇanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ abhiññāya viññāṇassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā.
sn22.56:15.1.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known consciousness in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding consciousness, are freed by not grasping: they are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn22.56:15.2.en: Those who are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m are consummate ones.

sn22.57:5.2.pli: evaṁ rūpassa assādaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ rūpassa ādīnavaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ rūpassa nissaraṇaṁ abhiññāya rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā.
sn22.57:5.2.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, are freed by not grasping: they are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn22.57:5.3.en: Those who are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m are consummate ones.

sn22.57:17.2.pli: evaṁ viññāṇassa assādaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ viññāṇassa ādīnavaṁ abhiññāya, evaṁ viññāṇassa nissaraṇaṁ abhiññāya viññāṇassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā.
sn22.57:17.2.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding consciousness, are freed by not grasping: they are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn22.57:17.3.en: Those who are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m are consummate ones.

an7.49:14.3.pli: Dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṁ viharato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
an7.49:14.3.en: When a mendicant often meditates with a mind reinforced with the perception of not-self in suffering, their mind is rid of I-making, mine-making, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli. It has gone beyond discrimination, and is peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

an7.49:15.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena cetasā bahulaṁ viharato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu na ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
an7.49:15.1.en: If a mendicant often meditates with a mind reinforced with the perception of not-self in suffering, but their mind is not rid of I-making, mine-making, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; nor has it gone beyond discrimination, and is not peaceful or [38;5;121mwell freed[0m,

an7.49:16.1.pli: Sace pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena cetasā bahulaṁ viharato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttaṁ.
an7.49:16.1.en: But if a mendicant often meditates with a mind reinforced with the perception of not-self in suffering, and their mind is rid of I-making, mine-making, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and it has gone beyond discrimination, and is peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m,

sn46.8:3.1.pli: “Satisambojjhaṅgaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu ārabbhamāno pajānāti ‘cittañca me suvimuttaṁ, thinamiddhañca me susamūhataṁ, uddhaccakukkuccañca me suppaṭivinītaṁ, āraddhañca me vīriyaṁ, aṭṭhiṁ katvā manasi karomi, no ca līnan’ti …pe…
sn46.8:3.1.en: As a mendicant rouses up the awakening factor of mindfulness, they understand: ‘My mind is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m. I’ve eradicated dullness and drowsiness, and eliminated restlessness and remorse. My energy is roused up, and my mind is sharply focused, not sluggish.’ …

sn46.8:3.2.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ āvuso, bhikkhu ārabbhamāno pajānāti ‘cittañca me suvimuttaṁ, thinamiddhañca me susamūhataṁ, uddhaccakukkuccañca me suppaṭivinītaṁ, āraddhañca me vīriyaṁ, aṭṭhiṁ katvā manasi karomi, no ca līnan’”ti.
sn46.8:3.2.en: As they rouse up the awakening factor of equanimity, they understand: ‘My mind is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m. I’ve eradicated dullness and drowsiness, and eliminated restlessness and remorse. My energy is roused up, and my mind is sharply focused, not sluggish.’

thag1.43:1.2.en: I’m very [38;5;121mwell freed[0m from three crooked things:

sn22.4:3.1.pli: “Rūpadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, tesaṁ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā ‘cittaṁ suvimuttanti’ vuccati.
sn22.4:3.1.en: “Householder, consider any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for the form element; any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies. With the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of that, the mind is said to be ‘[38;5;121mwell freed[0m’.

sn22.4:4.4.pli: viññāṇadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, tesaṁ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā ‘cittaṁ suvimuttanti’ vuccati.
sn22.4:4.4.en: the consciousness element; any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies. With the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of that, the mind is said to be ‘[38;5;121mwell freed[0m’.

sn35.157:1.5.en: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn35.157:1.14.en: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

sn35.159:1.5.en: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn35.159:1.14.en: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

sn22.92:1.3.pli: “kathaṁ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṁ passato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttan”ti?
sn22.92:1.3.en: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m?”

sn22.92:2.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, rāhula, jānato evaṁ passato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttan”ti.
sn22.92:2.6.en: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

sn22.125:1.3.pli: “kathaṁ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṁ passato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhā samatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttan”ti?
sn22.125:1.3.en: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m?”

sn22.125:2.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, kappa, jānato evaṁ passato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhā samatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttan”ti.
sn22.125:2.6.en: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

sn18.22:2.5.en: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

sn22.72:1.3.en: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m?”

sn22.72:1.12.pli: Evaṁ kho, surādha, jānato evaṁ passato imasmiñca saviññāṇake kāye, bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅkāramamaṅkāramānāpagataṁ mānasaṁ hoti vidhā samatikkantaṁ santaṁ suvimuttan”ti …pe…
sn22.72:1.12.en: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.” …

sn22.52:1.18.en: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.”

an5.200:1.5.pli: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ suvisaṁyuttaṁ kāmehi;
an5.200:1.5.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from sensual pleasures.

an5.200:5.3.pli: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ suvisaṁyuttaṁ sakkāyena;
an5.200:5.3.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, [38;5;121mwell freed[0m, and well detached from identity.

an10.19:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.19:1.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, is endowed with six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has pure intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is [38;5;121mwell freed[0m in mind and [38;5;121mwell freed[0m by wisdom.

sn6.3:8.3.en: He’s a mendicant fair in ethics, with heart [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.

sn1.38:8.2.pli: “passa samādhiṁ subhāvitaṁ cittañca suvimuttaṁ, na cābhinataṁ na cāpanataṁ na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagataṁ.
sn1.38:8.2.en: “See, his immersion is so well developed, and his mind is so [38;5;121mwell freed[0m—not leaning forward or pulling back, and not held in place by forceful suppression.

an7.56:1.6.en: “Sir, these nuns are [38;5;121mwell freed[0m without anything left over!”

mn116:6.36.en: and the Buddha Kaṇha, his mind [38;5;121mwell freed[0m.
